name: places/ChIJi6wqqaVZwokRGr5R0dVtAbg
adrFormatAddress: 766 6th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA

editorialSummary.text: Grab-&-go selection of upscale prepared foods attached to a sprawling gourmet grocery store.

originalText.text:
This Fairway has great options in prepared food, not so great in other non-food areas, a small fresh sushi and salad bar, and a convenient location.

What this Fairway does not lack is all of the anxiety and excitement.  This, because I always find myself running around in circles through this supermarket, to escape the plain clothes individuals who chase after me like a scene from an 80s cartoon.

And the more I anxiously circle around and around and around the store, zig zag up and down the aisles, the more the individual(s) who are circling around me behind me, chase behind me through the aisles with the cell phone in hand. As if I am going to get CAUGHT shopping.

Like, "GOTCHA! Black while shopping!"

I mean, come on! Seriously? It's 2023! Donald Trump could not have possibly sent this society backwards several decades during his short 4 years in office.

So during today's visit, after being chased around the store by a man in the yellow shirt (photos attached), he then waited for me to pay for my items so that he could then FOLLOW ME OUT OF THE STORE AND DOWN THE STREET!

With his phone in his hand, mind you.

He made no purchase. He was literally just there to follow me around the store while I made consumer decisions. Except those consumer decisions came with a side of dread, doom, and hopelessness - scared to death of what the man in the yellow shirt was going to do to me next.

It's open season on us women now, apparently. Ladies, please be careful. I truly don't know what to say. I just feel so bad that society has come to this. Truly a shame.

originalText.text: Typical city market. It had a variety of items that you'd expect in a market. There is an excellent cheese, olive, meat/deli and seafood section. The bakery was fairly large and the pastries were fresh. The line moved quickly.

text.text: Typical city market. It had a variety of items that you'd expect in a market. There is an excellent cheese, olive, meat/deli and seafood section. The bakery was fairly large and the pastries were fresh. The line moved quickly.

originalText.text: They need more, regular check out stations than the poor girl who has to help so many in self check out. She is definitely overworked and under paid. Staff doesnt help u find anything they just shout out....AISLE 3, AISLE 8 OR WHATEVER. This is not a customer friendly store.

text.text: They need more, regular check out stations than the poor girl who has to help so many in self check out. She is definitely overworked and under paid. Staff doesnt help u find anything they just shout out....AISLE 3, AISLE 8 OR WHATEVER. This is not a customer friendly store.

originalText.text: Great store! Very well stocked and there are a variety of store brand and regular branded items. Not too sure about the price comparison across similar stores. Fairway did not seem cheaper but had a lot of goods. For the perishable items I think the prices are similar across town.

text.text: Great store! Very well stocked and there are a variety of store brand and regular branded items. Not too sure about the price comparison across similar stores. Fairway did not seem cheaper but had a lot of goods. For the perishable items I think the prices are similar across town.

originalText.text: Came here on holidays. We‘re are used to huge groceries in Michigan, but this Market in the Heart of NY is nice but little overpriced. Clean and well-assorted store.
